about.title: The King's Kitchen Garden
about.subtitle: An exceptional heritage in the heart of Versailles

introduction.title: An exceptional garden
introduction.description1: The King's Kitchen Garden of Versailles is a unique historical site, created between 1678 and 1683 by Jean-Baptiste de La Quintinie to supply the royal table of Louis XIV. This masterpiece of French garden art spans 9 hectares in the heart of Versailles.
introduction.description2: With its 29 walled gardens and terraces, the King's Kitchen Garden represents the pinnacle of French horticultural art from the Grand Si√®cle. It bears witness to the genius of its creator who transformed marshy land into a productive garden of exceptional beauty.
introduction.imageAlt: View of the Grand Basin of the King's Kitchen Garden

history.title: 350 years of history
history.description1: Commissioned by Louis XIV and designed by Jean-Baptiste de La Quintinie, the King's Kitchen Garden was intended to provide fruits and vegetables for the royal table. La Quintinie developed revolutionary techniques there to grow early produce and extend harvest seasons.
history.description2: In the 19th century, Auguste Hardy founded the first National School of Horticulture there, transforming the place into a center of training and innovation. Today, this tradition continues with the National School of Landscape Architecture which continues to train tomorrow's landscape architects.
history.imageAlt: The King's Gate, historic entrance to the Kitchen Garden

today.title: A living laboratory
today.description1: Today, the King's Kitchen Garden remains a place of production, education and research. Students from the National School of Landscape Architecture learn traditional techniques while experimenting with tomorrow's sustainable practices.
today.description2: Open to the public, it offers guided tours, educational workshops and cultural events. Its fruits and vegetables are sold on site, perpetuating the site's nourishing tradition while financing its conservation.
today.imageAlt: Learning gardens of the King's Kitchen Garden

mapIntro.title: Discover your audio guide
mapIntro.subtitle: Follow these 3 simple steps to make the most of your visit

step1.title: 1. Locate yourself on the map
step1.description: Allow geolocation to see your real-time position and navigate through the King's Kitchen Garden.
step1.tip: Your position will appear with a blue icon on the map

step2.title: 2. Explore points of interest
step2.description: Discover the remarkable places in the garden by tapping on the colored markers.
step2.tip: Each place has its own color and unique story

step3.title: 3. Listen to information
step3.description: Press the play button to listen to audio commentary for each place you visit.
step3.tip: You can listen at your own pace and repeat as much as you want
